definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Ecological conservation development areas primarily farmland transfor into urban construction sites.
sentences.chinese: 生态涵养发展区主要是耕地转化成城市建设用地。

sentences.english: The cultural quality high has the self-control, understands the life, the heavy sentiment has the family sense of responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 文化素质高有涵养，懂生活，重感情有家庭责任感。

sentences.english: I think Chinese women are beautiful and so cultured.
sentences.chinese: 我认为中国女人都很漂亮，而且有涵养。

sentences.english: Calm is a kind of life conservation, innocence is a character dictates.
sentences.chinese: 淡定是一种人生涵养，纯真是一种性格使然。

sentences.english: Representing the self-containedness, self-restraint and the essence of well-balanced tension and relaxation of the oriental culture.
sentences.chinese: 是体现东方文化的内敛，涵养，处世的张弛有度。

sentences.english: As a result, how to conserve moral resources has been a crucial task for the present China.
sentences.chinese: 因此，涵养道德资源是当前王为重要的任务。

sentences.english: Try channeling yourself into creating something artisitc.
sentences.chinese: 尝试让自己创作些有艺术涵养的东西。

definition: to train/to educate/to bring up/to nurture/education/culture/upbringing/early conditioning
